instance.context: That same year , he moved to the Daily Herald and stayed there until 1953 . Finally , Low moved to the Manchester Guardian and was there from 1953 . Low received a knighthood in 1962 and died in London in 1963 .

British Cartoon Archive David Low at Library of Congress Authorities , with 40 catalogue records

His professional career began at The Canterbury Times in 1910 . The following year he moved to
Australia and worked for the The Bulletin . His work attracted the attention of Henry Cadbury , the part owner of The Star , and Low moved to London in 1919 , working for that paper until 1927 , when he moved to the Evening Standard .

=== World
War II === His works are featured in many British history textbooks . One of Low 's most famous cartoons , Rendezvous , was first published in the Evening Standard on 20 September 1939 .

He left
the Evening Standard in 1950 . That same year , he moved to the Daily Herald and stayed there until 1953 . Finally , Low moved to the Manchester Guardian and was there from 1953 .
